agency_desc: A nonprofit family practice physician group offering full spectrum family medicine services for those in Greene County.
service_description: Provides full-service family health care to Greene County persons of all ages, regardless of their ability to pay. Primary medical services include treatment for minor injuries and illnesses, physical exams for sports/school/employment, immunizations, lab work, wellness care, and treatment of acute and chronic health conditions. Mental health evaluations and general counseling services are also offered. Staff is available to assist patients with finding and understanding health insurance options (including Medicaid, Medicare, and marketplace plans). Referrals to other care providers and/or social services may also be provided as needed.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open; primarily serves Greene County

agency_desc: Domestic Violence, Sexual Violence and Human Trafficking services. Provides emergency shelter, crisis intervention, secure housing options and supportive services to victims of domestic and sexual violence, stalking and human trafficking as well as prevention programming for youth and in-service training for gateway professionals.
service_description: Provides victim assistance and crisis response to both male and female victims of domestic violence, human trafficking, or sexual assault. Services include court accompaniment, assistance filing a protective order, advocacy, and case management. A 24-hour hotline is available to answer questions about domestic violence or sexual assault, assist victims in preparing safety plans, and provide information and referrals to area resources.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-6pm -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Survivor of domestic violence, sexual assault, human trafficking, and stalking

agency_desc:
Seeks to match lower income residents of Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, and Vigo County with local volunteer attorneys for free legal assistance.

Intake applications taken: Tuesdays 5-7pm and Thursdays 11am-1pm
site_name: DISTRICT 10 PRO BONO PROJECT - GREENE COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_name: LEGAL ASSISTANCE - GREENE COUNTY COUNSEL IN THE COURT
service_description: Offers a walk-in legal clinic where people without legal counsel can speak with volunteer attorneys and law students about family law and get help with paperwork. Consultation only; no legal representation available. First come, first served.
site_details: Clients can access this service by calling (812)269-6463, and if the attorney isn't available to answer, by leaving a message for a call back or to request a zoom session.
site_eligibility: Have a case pending in Clay, Greene, Hendricks, Lawrence, Monroe, Morgan, Owen, Putnam, Sullivan, or Vigo County -- Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of federal poverty guidelines -- Have a civil case that requires an attorney -- Not currently represented by an attorney

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information, training, and placement for people interested in becoming foster parents.
site_name: DEBRA CORN FOSTER CARE - BLOOMFIELD OFFICE
service_description: Provides information, training, and placement for people interested in becoming foster parents.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Legal resident of Indiana -- Age 21 or older -- Able to pass appropriate criminal and medical background checks -- With resources to care for one or more children in need of specialized and therapeutic foster care

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that helps individuals find employment opportunities.
service_description: Provides on-the-job training to low-income adults. Clients are matched with participating social service agencies where they develop job skills while working 18 hours per week, earning at least the current minimum wage.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older -- Household income at or below 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- Currently unemployed* Eligible to work in the United States

site_eligibility: Living in the Bloomfield, Linton Stockton, Shakamak, Northeast Sullivan, Southwest Sullivan, or White River Valley school district of Greene and Sullivan county -- Ages 3-22 years -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, and hearing impairments

agency_name: BEECH CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - GREENE COUNTY
agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
site_name: BEECH CREEK TOWNSHIP TRUSTEE - GREENE COUNTY
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Varies; voicemail available daily 24 hours -- By appointment only
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Conducts local health fairs, provides health education services to the public, and maintains the lending library and other information resources for the County.
site_details: Call for information about arranging a group presentation.
site_eligibility: Schools, community organizations, and other groups in Greene County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides inspections, permits, code enforcement, and other services to protect the health and safety of Greene County residents. Regulates septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations. Offers information and referrals regarding substandard housing conditions, sanitation violations, safety hazards posed by vacant buildings, air or water pollution, and household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Green County

Regulates septic systems, public swimming pools, and food service establishments in the county. Investigates reports of sanitation violations. Offers information and referrals regarding substandard housing conditions, sanitation violations, safety hazards posed by vacant buildings, air or water pollution, and household health and environmental hazards such as mold, lead, radon, tap water contamination, mosquitoes, and rodents.
site_details: Call for information, to request services, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Green County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Immunizations: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Greene County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Greene County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Maintains records of all births and deaths that occur in the County and provides certified copies of birth and death certificates for fixed fees.
site_details: Walk in, download application from website, or call to have application sent by mail. -- Bring or mail in completed application, required documentation, and payment. -- Indiana birth certificates and death records may also be requested online at https://www.vitalchek.com/ this service is offered by a third-party and is not directly affiliated with the health department.
site_eligibility: Births/deaths occurring in Greene County-- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate

service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- TB Testing: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Greene County

service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (Tdap), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Immunizations: By appointment only
site_eligibility: Living in Greene County -- Age 19 or older

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for details.
